benchmark_details.name: SV-TRUST EVAL-C
benchmark_details.overview: SV-TRUST EVAL-C is a benchmark designed to evaluate LLMsâ€™ abilities for vulnerability analysis of code written in the C programming language through structure reasoning and semantic reasoning, assessing how models identify relationships between code elements and their logical consistency under varying data and control flow complexities.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of the SV-TRUST EVAL-C benchmark is to systematically evaluate the reasoning capabilities of large language models (LLMs) in analyzing vulnerabilities within source code.

data.source: The SV-TRUST EVAL-C dataset is developed based on the Structure-Oriented Variants Generator utilizing components from the Juliet Test Suite.
data.annotation: Automatically generated based on structural and semantic properties of the code.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the correct identification of vulnerabilities through structured reasoning and semantic understanding in question-answering tasks.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better reasoning capabilities of the models in vulnerability analysis.
methodology.baseline_results: The results show significant variance across11 evaluated LLMs, with top-performing models scoring below 50% in semantic reasoning tasks.
methodology.validation: The benchmark is validated through extensive testing against known vulnerabilities from the Juliet Test Suite.
